tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Dr. Anuj Chawla is nothing short of a miracle worker. I suffered a complex trimalleolar ankle fracture and was understandably terrified. After consulting with several orthopedic surgeons, I found immense comfort and confidence in Dr. Chawla. His expertise and compassionate demeanor made a world of difference. Not only did he successfully perform the challenging surgery, but his unwavering support throughout my recovery was invaluable. His care extended beyond my own health when my daughter had an accident, recommending a specialist and following up on her progress. 

I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Anuj Chawla ** *** **** ********** ******* ** ***** **** **** ****** **** *****

Doctor paid full attention to the issue, even though it was a small one. He was very patient and offered to wait for us to get an XRay done and revisit after an hour even though his time in the hospital was over. 
He explained in detail the plus and minus of getting a bunion surgery done.

Also when shown an mri he said maybe further mri (motion mri ) needs to be done. * **** **** **** ***** *** *** ***** *** does not have the empathy or attitude needed to treat patients ethically.

He tried to comfort her will smile on face.

tags: Wait time,
review: I had gone for a foot injury of my 72 year old mother-in-law which we suspected to be a hairline fracture. We arrived well before the appointment time and  informed the attendant. But the doctor arrived 30 minutes after the appointment time (there was nobody before us)We then had to wait again for more than 30 minutes for the doctor to come back from his rounds to show him the X-Ray.We tried to complain that overall it too us 2.5 hours for a simple case of hairline fracture (with overall consultation time of 20 minutes) even when there were no other waiting patients and even for such an old patient.The doctor told us we should keep 2-3 hours free for an OPD appointment in CK Birla hospital. He also said if he wants to get it done faster we should visit his private clinic. I am not aware why the doctor was repeatedly late and he didn't try to explain. However he was clearly unempathetic *** ********* ** ********* *******
reply_text:
Dear Abhishek,

Thank you for your feedback as it’s gives a chance for us to share a clinicians side of the story as well.
You came with your mother for a week plus old injury with an appointment time of 11:45pm. I was in the emergency seeing my post- operative patients and consulted your mother at 12:15pm. I advised x rays for her which were done around 1pm. You came back and was informed by the room coordinator that there is another doctor seeing a patient in the same room (room no 8) and once that patient is done, you will be called. Once that patient was over, I was called by my coordinator at 1:36pm and I was in room at 1:38pm. 
The moment you entered the room, you rudely mentioned that this hospital is the most inefficient hospital and you had to wait for 2 hours for a simple consultation with x ray. I patiently explained the x ray findings to your mother reassuring her that it’s not a major injury and she will be fine. 
You then said “why should I come to consult you in this hospital if you also take the same time as the other bigger hospital”. 
Then I mentioned that if you come to a hospital, you should keep time handy (considering wait time at various places including radiology room and consultation room) as both rooms were continuously attending to patients in the meanwhile. And if you want a quick treatment then you should go to a clinic. It was you who mentioned that yes I realised later that you have a clinic close to my residence. 

When a doctor is working in a hospital, he is attending to patients in opd, emergency and those coming for smaller procedures and dressings all at the same time and even the ward patients. 

I showed empathy to your mother despite your choice of words for me and my hospital which was totally uncalled for. I hope that you also develop some empathy for the clinicians. 
Wish your mother a speedy recovery!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review: I had suffered an ankle injury in March 2019. Before visiting Dr Chawla I visited 3-4 top orthopedics throughout NCR for my injury. None of them were able to help me much. They wouldn't listen to me properly and neither would they properly examine my injury.I finally consulted Dr Chawla in March 2020. He was extremely friendly, made me feel comfortable and conducted my examination thoroughly. He was extremely patient, answered all my questions. Finally he performed surgery on my ankle. It's been 2 moths, and I feel much better. The doctor is always available to answer my questions and regularly keeps taking updates on my recovery

tags: None
review: The Doctor was thorough in their examination and explained everything very well, using visual aids. I have no complaints with the Doctor apart from the delay. I had booked an appointment for 6 and got a all asking me to come by 6:30. I reached a few minutes before 6:30 but I wasn’t able to access the Doctor before 6:50. I had a work call at 7:30 and my appointment got over at 7:28. As much as everything else went in support of the Doctor, the delay caused significant anxiety and I wish I had been informed to come at 7. I would’ve just rescheduled my call, in that case.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: Dr.Anuj Chawla is a very friendly and calm doctor who doesn't believe in assumptions but investigations of the problem stated by the patient. I am presently going to him for my feet and ankle problem which assumes to be related to osteoporosis and marrow edema, but as said, since Doctor Anuj believes in investigations first, so has adviced me to get a blood test and a hip and lumbar spine xray done before he starts off with further treatment..he hasn't prescribed so many medicines unnecessarily but has only given me two medicines, which I felt very nice and feeling okay too...still a long way to go ...but still very happy with his treatment procedure, as he explains very well...Very happy to be under his treatment ..

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review: Dr. Anuj is very calm and friendly, I visited him 3 months back with twisted ankle and from test results it came into notice that there are 2 fractures and it will require a surgery, he explained the procedure precisely and also mentioned that with proper rest and physiotherapy it would take about 3 months to recover.  I didn't face any issues pre and post the treatment, I am now fully recovered and can start the normal activities. I'm satisfied with his consultation and treatment, would definitely recommend for any foot related issues.Lastly would definitely like to thank staff of CK Birla and their services, they genuinely take care of the patients very well and always seeks feedbacks for any further improvements.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: I took my husband, who was in pain and could not walk due to pain in his hip area and left leg. Dr. Anuj was really kind to rent a wheel chair for travel from home, minimising our stress to reach the clinic. He patiently explained the problem to my husband, as well as to us. He explained the treatment options available and answered all our queries. The clinic was well equipped and we did not have to step out for x-ray. We are satisfied with the consultation and the treatment provided. Would highly recommend.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I was concerned about my foot that i injured while playing football, and hence saw Dr Chawla. I thought it was a sprain, but was unsure since the swelling was disallowing me from putting pressure on it. 

It was a good visit to Sian ortho and foot clinic. I received a message with my appointment time beforehand. I didn't have to wait at all. I got good advice; was explained what happened quite well. The X-rays, from multiple angles, happed in a timely manner. And my foot seems to be in recovery now. 

A good ortho *** *** clinic to visit for Gurgaon residents.
reply_text: Thank you for your kind words. I wish you the best of health.

review:
My daughter,  2 years old fell off while riding scooter. 
She injured her chin and we were suspecting fracture in her arm as well. 
We contacted Dr Anuj Chawla. He was v prompt in dealing with my child. He took a v intelligent decision of not putting stiches. He provided a world class treatment for my child and also made sure there was no bone fractured or sprained.
He was v friendly for the follow up visits. 
I would highly recommend Dr Anuj Chawla for any medical emergencies.
reply_text: Thank you for your kind words. I wish you and your daughter the best of health.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,
review:
I recently underwent a bone fusion surgery and an osteotomy of my right foot which was performed by Dr Anuj Chawla supported by Dr Reetadyuti Mukhopadhyay at the CK Birla Hospital in Gurgaon. 

Dr Chawla is a thorough professional, an excellent doctor and a patient listener.

He explained the surgery process very meticulously to my family and me and gave me the confidence to go through the surgery calmly without any anxiety.

Post my surgery Dr Chawla continues to engage with me and monitor my progress personally. 

His commitment to his work and the ease with which he makes his patients comfortable is quite amazing.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Wait time,
review:
This was for my sister in law’s treatment for hairline talar neck fracture and ligament tear.

Dr. Anuj was extremely patient with us and gave us ample time and explained the issue in detail.

Patient needed to travel soon after the injury and the plaster. His guidance to split the plaster for air travel came in very handy. 

He also gave us multiple options in order to suit our requirements along with suggesting the best one.

Patient was in double mind at last minute on late evening around 8pm and he was patient enough to wait for us for our final decision and complete the plaster.

He is very friendly *** ************* *** I would highly recommend him.

I myself have visited him for my treatment as well.

tags: Treatment satisfaction,
review: Doctor after seeing the x-ray said that there was a hairline fracture. ******** *** ***** ******* *** ** *** ***** ****** ********* **** ** ******** ******** *** ******** doctor recommended putting the foot on cast.took second opinion * **** ******* ** ******** *** ** **** *** **** * **** ***** ********
reply_text:
Dear Mam/ Sir,
Thank you for your feedback. I remember you coming with your son 2 weeks back after he injured due to fall from cycle. I did 4 well performed x-rays (including one of uninjured foot) for better comparison in view of previous foot treatment that your child sought after his birth (but charged for 2). I did compare the opposite sides x ray to show you that the fracture line collaborated with site of tenderness(pain on pressing). I informed you that it’s a stable fracture as he has been walking on it and it is hairline. The reason for advising the cast was to give better rest to child and for better compliance. I hope that he recovers well and I wish you and your child best of health.
